author: mmyannn
title: Truly slowly becoming trash
content: I want to start by saying I started building so many memories through Snapchat. It was the best app to exist for the longest time. After a while, I decided to delete it and didn‚Äôt download it back for over a year. Today, I decided to get it back. A lot has changed. First of all suddenly you need to pay for your memories? And then, the watermarks. Can it get any worse? Apparently it can. I decide to go change my username because I don‚Äôt like my current one. I try it and then it asks for my password, which I forgot. So, I go to put in and verify my email, but then it gives an error. I try it again two or three times and it kicks me out onto the LOG IN screen. Now I‚Äôm thinking ‚Äúweird..‚Äù I try to log in and since I don‚Äôt remember my password and don‚Äôt have my email linked to my account, I use my phone number. Once I write it down, it tells me that my account was locked for apparently violating the community guidelines. So now I get more mad and go check it out in the Help Centre. Apparently now my account is permanently locked AND I can‚Äôt make an appeal. Oh, and Help Centre and Support are NO help. Now I‚Äôm thinking ‚Äúgreat, this was the worst it could get.‚Äù But no, I was wrong. I get mad and try my number a couple of times and it decides to say that I tried too many times and that I should try later. I‚Äôm like, okay ‚ÄúI‚Äôll wait.‚Äù Tell me why my friend texts me, saying that my account isn‚Äôt anywhere. She searched in her friends, she searched in quick add. My account is nowhere. So I go to log in again, and when I write down my username, guess what it says. Of course, it says that the username I wrote down isn‚Äôt linked to any account. So now not only Snapchat wants money for you to keep memories, it adds watermarks to things you save, AND also DELETES your account with ALL your memories and friends WITHOUT your permission? I‚Äôm honestly so so so disappointed and unless my account can be magically revived, I‚Äôm not using this stupid app again. I hope they know they‚Äôre gonna keep losing users like me if they keep this up.

author: Reham.Abdulreda
title: Snap
content:
Hello Snapchat,

We, the users, are not satisfied with the latest update of the application. Why are our precious memories being restricted? Why do we now have to pay for a subscription in order to access them? Not everyone has the financial ability to pay, especially with the current circumstances.

We rely on Snapchat to save our photos because of its accuracy and reliability. Many of our memories are stored within the app, and 5MB of storage is simply not enough. We kindly ask you to reconsider this update so we can continue using Snapchat the way we love. Our memories are very important to us, and we value them deeply through your platform.

We hope that you will remove or adjust this update to allow all users to access their memories freely. Forcing users to pay in order to view what is already theirs feels unfair and greedy.

Once again, we sincerely ask you to reconsider this matter.

author: trustyrug
title: Disappointed.
content:
Snapchat‚Äôs latest plan for an update is deeply disrespectful to users who cherish their memories. As someone who has used the app to store precious moments of family, friends, and beloved pets, many of whom are no longer with me, this decision to monetize memories is beyond disappointing. These photos and videos are more than just digital content; they are my only connection to loved ones who have passed, and now Snapchat is forcing me to pay for the ability to keep them.
I will never pay for memories. They are priceless, and I should not be coerced into a subscription just to hold onto my personal history. I‚Äôll be backing up all of my memories to a flash drive and leaving Snapchat permanently, along with any other services associated with them. It‚Äôs clear that I‚Äôm not alone in this sentiment. This move feels like a betrayal to long-time users, and I won‚Äôt stand for it.
Snapchat, you‚Äôve lost a customer, and I‚Äôm sure many more will follow. It‚Äôs a sad day when an app turns its back on its most loyal users.

author: Dystopali23
title: (Potential Rumor) Memories will be Paid subscription
content:
Are you seriously trying to make memories a PAID subscription feature now?? Like, what is going on with Snapchat lately?? I‚Äôve had this app for YEARS, it‚Äôs where so many of my favorite memories, pictures, and videos are stored ‚Äî and now I‚Äôm seeing rumors that they might lock access to memories behind Snapchat+ or a subscription?? Even if it‚Äôs just a rumor, the fact that people believe it tells you everything about how greedy and ridiculous this app has gotten.

It used to be about connecting, having fun, and sharing little moments with friends. Now it‚Äôs like every basic feature we‚Äôve had for free forever is suddenly ‚Äúpremium.‚Äù Why should I have to pay to see MY OWN MEMORIES that I created and saved? That‚Äôs not a ‚Äúplus‚Äù feature, that‚Äôs literally just holding users‚Äô data hostage.

Snapchat needs to remember what made people love this app in the first place. Stop nickel-and-diming loyal users who have supported you for years. If this rumor is true, it‚Äôs one of the lowest things a social media app could ever do ‚Äî and if it‚Äôs not, maybe take the hint from your user base and start rebuilding trust before everyone deletes this app for good.

This update feels sketchy, invasive, and money-hungry. Do better, Snapchat. author: Tanazzzzz
title: Disappointing
content:
I‚Äôve been using Snapchat for years, but the recent updates have honestly made the experience really frustrating and concerning. The new changes that reportedly allow others to see names on your Best Friends list are a serious privacy issue. Snapchat was supposed to be about personal connections and privacy, but this completely goes against that idea.

On top of that, people are facing problems with their Memories being deleted or disappearing without notice which is really disappointing, especially for users who‚Äôve trusted the app to store their special moments.

Snapchat needs to seriously reconsider these updates and prioritize user privacy and data security. Please fix these issues before more people lose trust in the platform.

author: mehraban sayah
title: Report
content:
I‚Äôm seriously warning Snapchat ‚Äî do not ever delete our drafts again. People spend time, effort, and creativity making those drafts, and losing them for no reason is beyond frustrating. It‚Äôs not just a ‚Äúfeature‚Äù we can redo; it‚Äôs our work, our memories, and our time.

If Snapchat keeps removing drafts without warning, people will stop trusting the app. We save things for a reason, and you have no right to erase them without asking. At least give users an option to back them up or a clear notice before they disappear.

This needs to change now. Stop deleting our drafts. Respect your users‚Äô effort.

You‚Äôre ruining throwing away your success and will become like KiK & MySpace. PLEASE DON‚ÄôT PUSH THE MASSES AWAY. We adore & value what you bring to our lives. 
Been with Snapchat since 2014, I truly miss the simplicity of it, my favorite Snapchat was when memories first launched. I remember when bitmojis first arrived, not only on Facebook anymore! I recall when you guys first introduced the articles & medias within the app. 
Growing so much has become a burden and has taken away from the joy of using your platform. 
We miss what once was. 
It grew successful because people love it, now it‚Äôs overstimulating for most because people no longer simply snap & chat anymore. You have done too much & taken it away from us. 


A simple proposal :   Offer a free version of snap that is older, example the 2018 versions, meanwhile offering the current snap with a subscription. 

Customer satisfaction is the life-line of any company due to CUSTOMERS BRINGING MONEY. There are other ways to make money & keep your business thriving.

author: Aya. Amer
content:
Hello Snapchat,

We, the users, are not satisfied with the latest update of the application. Why are our precious memories being restricted? Why do we now have to pay for a subscription in order to access them? Not everyone has the financial ability to pay, especially with the current circumstances.

We rely on Snapchat to save our photos because of its accuracy and reliability. Many of our memories are stored within the app, and 5MB of storage is simply not enough. We kindly ask you to reconsider this update so we can continue using Snapchat the way we love. Our memories are very important to us, and we value them deeply through your platform.

We hope that you will remove or adjust this update to allow all users to access their memories freely. Forcing users to pay in order to view what is already theirs feels unfair and greedy.

Once again, we sincerely ask you to reconsider this matter.

author: Violet Betters
title: the greed is sickening.
content:
I‚Äôve been using Snapchat since 2017, and I used to love this app. I‚Äôve had accounts, memories, streaks, and moments that mean a lot to me. I even lost my first account because I was banned for something I didn‚Äôt even do, and even though I couldn‚Äôt get any of my memories back, I still stuck with Snapchat and started fresh.

But this new update is honestly just disappointing. Snapchat used to be fun and personal, but now it‚Äôs all about money. First, they added Snapchat+, which I actually paid for because I liked the features and wanted to support the app. But now they‚Äôre adding even more versions of Snapchat Premium ‚Äî all with different prices ‚Äî and they‚Äôve gone as far as to limit how many memories you can save unless you pay for extra storage.

People use Snapchat to capture moments they‚Äôll never get back. Those memories shouldn‚Äôt suddenly come with a price tag. It‚Äôs so greedy and out of touch, especially for loyal users who‚Äôve been here for years. Snapchat was about connection and memories ‚Äî now it‚Äôs just about money. I genuinely hope they rethink this, because the direction they‚Äôre going in is ruining what made Snapchat special in the first place.

author: Goo ia
title: Another money hungry corporation
content: I‚Äôve used Snapchat for over a decade now, I have hundreds of memories from my childhood and early adulthood in this app. Snapchat has routinely felt like a safe app among all these other apps that are constantly changing. Now, Snapchat is apparently going to start charging people for the memories they have stored on the app. These past few years, the amount of ads on Snapchat has increased tenfold. You would think all these ads would bring in enough money, but apparently not. Once again I find myself disappointed in another app that is prioritizing profit over people. Don‚Äôt forget, that us longtime users are the reason Snapchat is so successful, and the reason its popularity has increased over the past few years. You are isolating us by forcing us to pay for something that for a long time was free. I hope you listen to these negative reviews and comments and choose to be better. Seriously disappointing.

author: brisgotfacts
title: Will leave the app!
content:
You cannot start charging for storage space on a picture app that‚Äôs always been optional. For years, people have trusted Snapchat to hold their most meaningful memories ‚Äî photos of loved ones who‚Äôve passed away, moments with friends they‚Äôll never see again, snapshots of who they used to be. Those aren‚Äôt just pictures sitting in a folder ‚Äî they‚Äôre pieces of people‚Äôs lives.

To suddenly put a price tag on that is beyond unfair ‚Äî it‚Äôs heartless. For so many, Snapchat wasn‚Äôt just an app; it was a time capsule, a safe place for memories that can‚Äôt be recreated. Taking that and turning it into a paid feature feels like taking advantage of the very people who made Snapchat what it is.

If anything, I‚Äôd rather pay Apple more money to save my photos than give Snapchat a dime for something that‚Äôs been free since the beginning. Because let‚Äôs be real ‚Äî once you start charging for memories, you lose the trust of the people who kept your app alive.

And trust me, many will just delete the app altogether. No one wants to pay for what used to be free ‚Äî especially when what you‚Äôre charging for are the memories we thought we could keep forever.

author: T8pw0rmz
title: Memories and support
content: Paying for Snapchat memories? Ok fine. Where my complaint lies is the exporting options we have. Info and instructions on this are extremely vague, so let me just clue you all in to how awful the exporting process is if you have as many Snapchat memories as I do. Each image downloaded on my computer from the export is a literal file (not technically an image) and I can only view what the image is if I open it on a web browser. Each video is an HEVC file and can‚Äôt be played on my computer without purchasing a video extension on the Microsoft store. How on earth am I supposed to go back and look through these in the future without being able to see any previews for anything? I‚Äôm going to have to pay money just to watch the videos and I will have to scroll through and periodically open images through a web browser to find a timeline or find something specific. I am less mad about having to pay for memory storage than I am about how the only options for exporting all of them are so inconvenient. I have been using Snapchat since 2016 and I have 9 years worth of videos and images I need to save (the file told me the total number was about 87k pics and vids) and not a single one is viewable in my files without external sources. That is actually insane. I have been a consistent and loyal Snapchat user for almost a decade and I cannot fathom how inconvenient they have made this process. Thank you Snapchat.
